availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Junius Lynch Clemmons (Jefferson County, Kentucky, lawyer. )

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, lawyer. Native of Forsyth County, North Carolina. Son of Benton Clemmons and Martha Dillon Clemmons. Married to Harriet Louisa Willis Clemmons on August 15, 1852 in Jefferson County, Kentucky. Attended the University of North Carolina, in Chapel Hill, North Carolina. Lawyer in Jefferson County, Kentucky in 1850. Lawyer in Jefferson County in 1860. Employed one enslaved person in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 182B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 5, p. 136.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 5, p. 274A.
Catalogue of the Members of the Dialectic Society, Instituted in the University of North Carolina, August 1st, 1795, (Raleigh: Thomas J. Demay, 1841), 13.
Catalogue of the Philanthropic Society, Instituted in the University of North Carolina, August 1st, 1795, (Raleigh: Seaton Gales, 1852), 42.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482707, p. 8.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994040, Jefferson County Births/Marriages/Deaths, p. 48.
"Junius Lynch Clemmons (1813-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #36457270, accessed April 1, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36457270/junius-lynch-clemmons.
